26eced26-ab8e-4634-95ef-b7a733816088.description: The earner of this micro-credential understands the connection between trauma and its biological and behavioral implications of human development. The earner is familiar with the trauma-informed care model and understands applications for both individual level and agency settings. The earner can identify and implement therapeutic treatment and intervention skills based upon the evidence-based practice model of Trauma-Focused Cognitive Behavioral Therapy.
26eced26-ab8e-4634-95ef-b7a733816088.name: Trauma-Focused Care Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: SWK 684 Specific Skills and Trauma-Focused Practice I and SWK 685 Specific Skills and Trauma-Focused Practice II.

9203783f-18bc-431f-82cf-4031e897939b.description: The earner of this micro-credential can analyze the intersection of social, health and legal systems and provide appropriate interventions and services to criminal offenders. The earner understands the relationships among law, criminal justice, and mental health and substance abuse treatment systems; and can explain how complex social issues intertwine with criminal behavior. The earner can identify the impact of relevant laws and social policies on treatment and correctional responses to crime.
9203783f-18bc-431f-82cf-4031e897939b.name: Forensic Social Work Undergraduate Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: SWK 572 Forensic Social Work;  SWK 612 Addiction and Family Violence or SWK 525 Substance Use and Abuse; and SWK 411: Social Work and the Law.

0e1197df-637c-47de-b5ed-cd714ff0d0c8.description: The earner of this micro-credential has developed skills and techniques necessary for working with older adults and systems that commonly serve them, can identify and analyze the major theories related to later life development, and is able to identify resources within local communities that help older adults remain independent. The earner demonstrates an ability to work with ethics and values specific to the older adult population, and recognizes the changing treatment needs of older adults.
0e1197df-637c-47de-b5ed-cd714ff0d0c8.name: Gerontology: Dynamics of Aging Undergraduate Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: SWK 578 Aging and Mental Health and SWK 579 Gerontology.

d8cd143e-2649-4402-94c0-d8c5ff669d44.description: The earner of this certificate has networked with local business leaders and is able to solve leadership problems through experiential learning.
d8cd143e-2649-4402-94c0-d8c5ff669d44.name: Eva G. & Oakley Farris Leadership Academy Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Meet as part of a cohort for half a day once a month for eight months, and participate in a full-day team-building retreat.

9418a35c-5e4c-46df-89cb-ce576e728984.description: The earner of this micro-credential is able to use American Sign Language and technology to effectively communicate and collaborate with people who are deaf. The earner has actively engaged with and acted as an ally for individuals who are deaf and can recognize, respect and adhere to deaf culture norms.
9418a35c-5e4c-46df-89cb-ce576e728984.name: American Sign Language Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: EDU 100 ASL Level I, EDU 111 ASL Level II, and EDU 294 ASL Level Ill.

b3cd2c30-f2a2-4138-9ce7-38efbd3b27a1.description: The earner of this micro-credential has basic knowledge of financial management, managerial accounting, people management and leadership, and marketing management.
b3cd2c30-f2a2-4138-9ce7-38efbd3b27a1.name: Business Management Decision Making Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title:
Complete these courses: ACC 610 Accounting in a Corporate Environment, MGT 605 Managing in Organizations,
FIN 605 Financial Management in Organizations,
and MKT 605 Marketing in Organizations.

aa643eae-0c55-417c-bb0b-4ce06544b3f6.description: The earner of this micro-credential recognizes the important role of federal, state and local governments in managing natural and man-made threats. The earner can develop and apply techniques for collaborating with community partners and is able to create a hazard-evaluation disaster concept model and vulnerability assessment. The earner comprehends the history of terrorism and evaluates counter-terrorism and domestic security efforts in the United States.
aa643eae-0c55-417c-bb0b-4ce06544b3f6.name: Disaster Readiness Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: PAD 681 Homeland Security, PAD 682 Emergency Management, and PAD 683 Terrorism.

6d4f50db-a566-4f36-9bb0-02ed171604bc.description: The earner of this micro-credential can apply employee-motivation and performance-enhancement strategies for more effective leadership and management, comprehend and apply relevant professional codes of ethics, and recognize and promote ethical behavior and practices in the workplace. The earner also understands issues of diversity and inclusion in the workplace, and possesses a variety of strategies for government and nonprofit organizations.
6d4f50db-a566-4f36-9bb0-02ed171604bc.name: Leadership in the Public Sector Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: PAD 630 Ethics and Decision Making in the Public Sector, PAD 631 Leading in Diverse Public Environments, and PAD 632 Executive Management and Public Leadership.

61ef5e9c-d204-4b1e-b216-2445fda9abf6.description: The earners of this micro-credential understand key terms, concepts, and theories in mindfulness. The earners can select and apply mindfulness practices to support their own well-being, and to address challenges in their lives and workplaces.
61ef5e9c-d204-4b1e-b216-2445fda9abf6.name: Mindfulness Fundamentals Graduate Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: EDU/HSR/SWK 522 The Mindful Helping Professional, and either EDU/HSR/SWK 523 The Mindful Leader or COU 575 Mindfulness and Contemplative Practices.

0f6929d2-73e8-4a92-978c-734a7db17ef2.description: The earner of this micro-credential can deliver high-quality environmental education using best practices in environmental education, in both current and alternative educational settings. Comprehending the importance of education, awareness, action and change, the earner understands the history, philosophy, methodologies, national standards, sustainable practices and current trends in the field of environmental education.
0f6929d2-73e8-4a92-978c-734a7db17ef2.name: Environmental Education Undergraduate Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: EDU 445 Fundamentals of Environmental Education; EDU 446 Teaching Environmental Education; and elective courses (choose one) EDU 447 Teaching and Learning in the Outdoor or EDU 448 Environmental Issues for Educators.

84199760-e7de-4ff1-b80a-1b83c63c5673.description: The earner of this certificate can communicate business-relevant implications of data analyses, craft questions to ensure analysis projects succeed, and design logical and structured analysis plans. The earner can use Excel functions to organize, query, and chart data; summarize data with pivot tables; analyze concepts and techniques for storytelling with data; and assemble a dashboard.
84199760-e7de-4ff1-b80a-1b83c63c5673.name: Data for Business Decision Making Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of all assessments in three courses offered via Coursera, with an overall average of at least 73% in each course: Data Visualization and Communication with Tableau, Duke University; Introduction to Data Analysis Using Excel, Rice University; and Creating Dashboards and Storytelling with Tableau, University of California, Davis.

f5b658c8-5343-4d13-b5f8-d8a5167426c5.description: The earner of this micro-credential has demonstrated leadership problem-solving and critical-thinking skills and developed the interpersonal and intrapersonal skills needed to build strong leader-follower relationships in a variety of contexts. The earner can use communication skills in the multiple modalities required of effective leaders (written, oral, and technical), apply ethical principles to leadership, successfully integrate the fundamentals of diversity into the leadership process.
f5b658c8-5343-4d13-b5f8-d8a5167426c5.name: Leadership Development Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the following courses: LDR 205 Human Relations in Organizations, LDR 308 Leadership Development, and LDR 320 Leading with Emotional Intelligence.

bc05222c-836d-47db-9bf9-99caa3e19829.description: The earner of this micro-credential can manage systems, processes, and relationships with coworkers, managers, subordinates, clients, and customers; motivate and influence others; and analyze and apply processes of individual and organizational change. They can apply negotiation tactics, analyze and manage the behavior of others where interests are in conflict, and structure projects.
bc05222c-836d-47db-9bf9-99caa3e19829.name: Leading People and Change Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: MGT 605 Managing in Organizations, MGT 620 Leading Organizational Change, MGT 621 Negotiation and Conflict Resolution, MGT 622 Essentials of Project Management.

ed1b7a81-fee9-45bd-96b5-6486e564b37e.description: The earners of this micro-credential understand key terms, concepts, and theories in mindfulness. The earners can select and apply mindfulness practices to support their own well-being, and to address challenges in their lives and workplaces.
ed1b7a81-fee9-45bd-96b5-6486e564b37e.name: Mindfulness Fundamentals Undergraduate Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: EDU/HSR/SWK 522 The Mindful Helping Professional, and either EDU/HSR/SWK 523 The Mindful Leader or COU 575 Mindfulness and Contemplative Practices.

8bde5253-f216-4987-b6b7-965e1cb34942.description: The earner of this micro-credential can apply the comparative method to explore what we can learn about humans by studying our close relatives, living non-human primates, and collect systematic observational data on primate behavior utilizing standard methods in the discipline. The earner can use the scientific method in designing, conducting, writing, and presenting their own original research project, and has knowledge of grant writing.
8bde5253-f216-4987-b6b7-965e1cb34942.name: Primatology Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title:
Complete these courses: ANT 202 Biological Anthropology or BIO 151 Introduction to Biology II; along with any three of the following:
ANT 334 Behavioral Field Methods; ANT 347 Primate Behavioral Ecology; ANT 348 Primate Sexuality; or BIO 440 Animal Behavior.

eb89c60b-63ca-48aa-b990-f4393c3f5d94.description: The earner of this micro-credential understands military culture, recognizes experiences common to veterans and their families, and is aware of the effects of contemporary military experience. The earner comprehends trauma that may result in homelessness, addiction, mental illness, PTSD, depression, and suicide, and is able to investigate the federal, state, community, and non-profit resources and benefits available to veterans, family members, and survivors.
eb89c60b-63ca-48aa-b990-f4393c3f5d94.name: Serving Veterans and Families Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete SWK 594 Introduction to Veterans Services, Policy, and Programming; and one of the following courses: PAD 501 Human Resource Management; SWK 684 Trauma-Focused Care; SWK 579 Gerontology; HSC 510 Trends and Cultural Issues in Healthcare; or HSC 620 Health Care Finance and Reimbursement.

20572d36-e9ef-4e09-b0ce-57bf5a3221ad.description: The earner of this micro-credential is knowledgeable about the administration of art museums, theaters, orchestras, dance companies, and other nonprofit arts organizations. They can create a 501(c)(3) or 501(c)(4) organization and develop strategies and techniques related to program and audience development, fund raising and management, and volunteer management.
20572d36-e9ef-4e09-b0ce-57bf5a3221ad.name: Arts Administration Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: PAD 594 Special Topics - Arts Administration, PAD 620 Managing Nonprofit Organizations, and either PAD 621 Resource Acquisition and Management or PAD 622 Volunteer Management.

f01652cc-a6d6-46d9-b9e9-036579138b77.description: The earner of this credential knows the basic processes required for clinical study design, implementation and analysis. They can apply ethical principles to the conduct of human clinical research, describe the relationship between current International Conference on Harmonisation – Good Clinical Practice (ICH-GCP) guidelines, and effectively study, conduct, and document trial objectives.
f01652cc-a6d6-46d9-b9e9-036579138b77.name: Clinical Research Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: CHP 604 Clinical Trials I, CHP 605 Clinical Trials II, CHP 606 Clinical Trials III.

c638fdc1-ae5b-4dea-b332-0d732e31091b.description: The earner of this micro-credential can analyze the intersection of social, health and legal systems and provide appropriate interventions and services to criminal offenders. The earner understands the relationships among law, criminal justice, and mental health and substance abuse treatment systems; and can explain how complex social issues intertwine with criminal behavior. The earner can identify the impact of relevant laws and social policies on treatment and correctional responses to crime.
c638fdc1-ae5b-4dea-b332-0d732e31091b.name: Forensic Social Work Graduate Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: SWK 572 Forensic Social Work; SWK 612 Addiction and Family Violence or SWK 525 Substance Use and Abuse; and SWK 411 Social Work and the Law.

95edf22e-b5dc-4ba7-8d52-582d5511862b.description: The earner of this micro-credential can use GIS software to solve spatial problems and create quality maps by following fundamental cartographic map design principles.
95edf22e-b5dc-4ba7-8d52-582d5511862b.name: GIS and Mapping Undergraduate Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: GEO 418 Geographic Information Systems and GEO 415 Cartography.

6cffcfbb-1ba5-498d-a869-fb9d6d8f6c29.description: The earner understands historical themes, narratives and events that have defined living conditions for populations in different regions, countries and settings, and identifies countries, regions, ethnic groups and religious groups in global context. The earner has developed cultural fluency necessary to understand core perspectives and values influential to population experiences, and recognizes the structures and realities created by political systems practiced in the world today.
6cffcfbb-1ba5-498d-a869-fb9d6d8f6c29.name: Global Awareness Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete three of these courses: HIS 111 Global Viewpoints in History, HIS 109 World History Since 1500, GEO 100 Global Viewpoints on Geography and the Human Landscape, ANT 201 World Cultures, PSC 102 Comparative Politics, or REL 200 World Religions and Cultures.

88c3bc3c-c5d1-4254-9686-2ec51f8b0c7d.description: The earner of this micro-credential recognizes when and where further information is needed; can locate evaluate, and employ information; and is able to design, execute, and assess success of information research plans.
88c3bc3c-c5d1-4254-9686-2ec51f8b0c7d.name: Navigating Professional Research Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: LIN 175 Information Literacy and LIN 302 Digital Searching Interfaces.

2b9c7f73-fd83-4cca-8133-0e77518db98c.description: The earner of this micro-credential exhibits knowledge of basic economic and personal finance concepts appropriate to K-12 educators and community stakeholders, and can implement innovative instructional materials and methodologies for economic reasoning and personal finance in diverse classroom settings. The earner understands learning and cognitive strategies for community stakeholders working with economics and financial literacy.
2b9c7f73-fd83-4cca-8133-0e77518db98c.name: Economics and Financial Literacy Education Graduate Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: ECO 580 Economics for Teachers and ECO 594 Teaching Econ/Fin Literacy Topics.

4b049bfa-eb69-47bd-a64c-00404698ffcd.description: The earner of this micro-credential can deliver high-quality environmental education using best practices in environmental education, in both current and alternative educational settings. Comprehending the importance of education, awareness, action and change, the earner understands the history, philosophy, methodologies, national standards, sustainable practices and current trends in the field of environmental education.
4b049bfa-eb69-47bd-a64c-00404698ffcd.name: Environmental Education Graduate Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: EDU 545 Fundamentals of Environmental Education and EDU 546 Teaching Environmental Education, with an additional elective.

dbbea1dc-2613-46db-a5ad-d36a4c86dc5f.description: The earner of this micro-credential can differentiate the determinants of value for purchases, suppliers, business, and demands, and measure supplier performance. They can apply alternative methods of network design and distribution systems in response to market dynamics, evaluate alternative approaches to inventory location/quantity, and compare and evaluate the design of distribution centers.
dbbea1dc-2613-46db-a5ad-d36a4c86dc5f.name: Global Supply Chain Management Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: MGT 610 Operations Management, MGT 641 Supply Chain Management, MGT 642 Strategic Sourcing, and MGT 643 Distribution and Logistics.

03c6e54b-dc71-4f44-81f9-b3219dc90b5f.description: The earner of this micro-credential understands museums in the past and present, including the legal, social, and political issues related to museums, their collections, and individual objects. The earner can describe the history of modern museums and the role(s) museums play in advancing an appreciation of culture. The earner has demonstrated skills in collections management, exhibition, and public outreach/programming, and applied concepts and methods at a museum through an internship.
03c6e54b-dc71-4f44-81f9-b3219dc90b5f.name: Museum Studies Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: ANT 307 Museum Methods; ANT 396 Museum Internship; and ANT 311 Museums in Contemporary Society or HIS 317 History Behind American Treasures.

6fa76ff6-5ad7-4e04-a78a-f4307c198ac3.description: The earner of this micro-credential understands archaeology's historical development in the US and the ways artifacts and materials are used to interpret the past. The earner has a working knowledge of current laws governing the practice of archaeology in the US, as well as the legal history behind them. The earner has practical, hands-on experience on archaeological sites, and displays theoretical and methodological understanding of how artifacts are documented and analyzed in the laboratory.
6fa76ff6-5ad7-4e04-a78a-f4307c198ac3.name: Cultural Resource Management Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: ANT 210 Archaeology Method and Theory and ANT 315 Archaeological Excavation Methods. Also complete two of the following: ANT 308 Cultural Resource Management, ANT 355 Archaeology Laboratory Analysis, or GEO 522 Historical Preservation.

ae68a8bf-f7d8-4147-8620-e30998206578.description: The earner of this micro-credential can explain the processes and technologies needed to secure the information infrastructure of a modern organization, apply security principles and practices to maintain operations in the presence of risks and threats, and build cloud-based IT systems and implement security measures to protect them.
ae68a8bf-f7d8-4147-8620-e30998206578.name: Cybersecurity: Fundamentals in the Cloud Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: MCY 601 Cybersecurity Fundamentals, MCY 611 Cloud Computing, and MCY 612 Cloud Security.

skills.name: Data Protection and Data Security Systems

b9d00f92-3172-49a1-b5ec-93cd6fe85b15.description: The earner of this certificate can communicate business-relevant implications of data analyses, craft questions to ensure analysis projects succeed, and design logical and structured analysis plans. The earner can use Excel functions to organize, query, and chart data; summarize data with pivot tables; analyze concepts and techniques for storytelling with data; and assemble a dashboard.
b9d00f92-3172-49a1-b5ec-93cd6fe85b15.name: Data for Business Decision Makers Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of all assessments in four courses offered via Coursera, with an overall average of at least 73% in each course: Foundations: Data, Data, Everywhere, Google; Data Visualization and Communication with Tableau, Duke University; Introduction to Data Analysis Using Excel, Rice University; and Creating Dashboards and Storytelling with Tableau, University of California, Davis.

69d0af8d-1840-4b8b-b4de-ebe5404b061f.description: The earner of this micro-credential understands the curricular process for program and course development, especially for healthcare professionals, and can identify ways to assess and evaluate program and student success. Recognizing the different roles of a healthcare educator, the earner can analyze teaching and learning methods appropriate for healthcare professionals.
69d0af8d-1840-4b8b-b4de-ebe5404b061f.name: Educating Health Professionals Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: CHP 500 Teaching & Learning in Healthcare Education, CHP 501 Assessment & Evaluation of the Healthcare, CHP 602 Curr, Dev & Eval for Healthcare Programs, and CHP 603 Role of the Healthcare Educator.

0b62a586-b60e-48dc-a5b1-47b0cdee4489.description: The earners of this micro-credential understand key terms, concepts, and theories in mindfulness. The earners can select and apply mindfulness practices to support their own well-being, and to address challenges in their lives and workplaces.
0b62a586-b60e-48dc-a5b1-47b0cdee4489.name: Fundamentals of Mindfulness Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: HSR 522 The Mindful Helping Professional, COU 575 Mindfulness & Contemplative Practices, and HSR/EDU/SOC 594 The Mindful Leader (course number change to EDU/HSR/SWK 523 effective Fall 2020).

9c62107f-a9d3-4935-9d1d-3f2b0c0a5b11.description: The earner of this micro-credential has developed skills and techniques necessary for working with older adults and systems that commonly serve them, can identify and analyze the major theories related to later life development, and is able to identify resources within local communities that help older adults remain independent. The earner demonstrates an ability to work with ethics and values specific to the older adult population, and recognizes the changing treatment needs of older adults.
9c62107f-a9d3-4935-9d1d-3f2b0c0a5b11.name: Gerontology: Dynamics of Aging Graduate Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: SWK 578 Aging and Mental Health and SWK 579 Gerontology.

4cc654b3-b811-4f5d-a777-3f861f7cc518.description: The earner of this micro-credential understands how training and development supports the strategic aims of the company, the needs assessment process, the value of a compensation strategy, and the role of consistency in pay policy. They can design and implement training programs, evaluate resources to find promising potential candidates, and plan and conduct effective interviews.
4cc654b3-b811-4f5d-a777-3f861f7cc518.name: Human Resource Management Graduate Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: MGT 605 Managing in Organizations, MGT 631 Training and Development, MGT 632 Compensation and Benefits, MGT 633 Talent Management.

d370b871-5423-45ba-bf26-165d7c8c5923.description: The earner of this micro-credential understands how training and development supports the strategic aims of the company, the needs assessment process, the value of a compensation strategy, and the role of consistency in pay policy. They can design and implement training programs, evaluate resources to find promising potential candidates, and plan and conduct effective interviews.
d370b871-5423-45ba-bf26-165d7c8c5923.name: Human Resource Management Undergraduate Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: MGT 340 Human Resource Administration, HRM 302 Recruitment and Selection, HRM 304 Compensation and Benefits, HRM 301 Training and Development.

141e37ca-103f-4c2a-9eb3-ece4214e288a.description: The earner of this micro-credential can identify strengths and contributions of community members with disability through an active and engaging partnership, and advocate and take action that leads toward an equitable community. They have demonstrated leadership by developing effective strategies for meaningfully including others with diverse strengths and needs into the community.
141e37ca-103f-4c2a-9eb3-ece4214e288a.name: Leadership, Education, Advocacy and Dis/Ability (LEAD) in a Diverse Society Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: EDS 452 Leadership, Education, Advocacy and Dis/Ability and EDS 453 Mentoring Field Experience.

664aadd0-0234-4180-a154-cb2fc9dd47fa.description: The earner of the Leading and Managing Through KPIs certificate has developed skills related to leading and managing teams. The earner is able to differentiate leading versus managing and identify top-level KPIs. Upon completion, the earner will be able to create and utilize SMART goals to drive performance and coach behaviors to meet KPIs and increase performance.
664aadd0-0234-4180-a154-cb2fc9dd47fa.name: Leading and Managing Through KPIs Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the following course: Leading and Managing Through KPIs and completing all course activities with 70% or above.

cfacc6e1-4172-46c1-aac2-023c778b5150.description: Earners of this micro-credential analyze the experiences and literary contributions of diverse groups of people, in particular those who have suffered discrimination, injustice, and exclusion. Credential holders demonstrate research, writing, and communication skills needed to live and work effectively in a contemporary global society with increasingly diverse and interdependent populations.
cfacc6e1-4172-46c1-aac2-023c778b5150.name: Literature, Justice, and Inclusion Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: ENG 212 Literatures of Inclusion, ENG 307 Diverse Voices in English Studies, and one of the following: ENG 217 African American Literature to 1940, ENG 218 African American Literature 1940 - Present, or ENG 316 Social Issues in Literature.

8659513d-07fe-4f79-9dc9-7cc4372ee057.description: The earner of this micro-credential demonstrates a contextual understanding of intercultural issues and perspectives, and can apply intercultural communication competencies for effective leadership in an inclusive and global workplace. The earner is able to leverage diverse perspectives to generate innovative solutions to complex problems.
8659513d-07fe-4f79-9dc9-7cc4372ee057.name: Navigating the Diverse Workplace Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title:
Complete these courses: ENG 674 Multicultural Literature,
PAD 631 Leading in Diverse Public Environments,
and HSC 610 Trends and Cultural Issues in Healthcare or EDG 606 Leadership in Diverse Society.

187f5211-6697-4d99-a6cb-53f1dbbc91d8.description: The earner of this micro-credential has developed speaking, writing, reading, listening and cultural skills in Japanese at an advanced level. The earner is able to apply language skills and cultural knowledge to work and professional contexts, and has knowledge of the cultures associated with the language of study through more in-depth examination of specific areas such as art, history or immigration.
187f5211-6697-4d99-a6cb-53f1dbbc91d8.name: Next-Step Japanese Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete JPN 304 Composition and Conversation, as well as a linguistics skills course, a professional skills course, and a cultural knowledge course.

64e9b57d-50dd-4afb-8469-c8280bfbbbc7.description: The earner of this micro-credential can work with various techniques involved in screen printing, including creating and printing multiple layered color prints, understanding color theory, and the basic elements and principles of good design. The earner has also developed strategies for creating personal imagery, professional presentation of work, problem solving skills, and working collaboratively with others in the class.
64e9b57d-50dd-4afb-8469-c8280bfbbbc7.name: Screen Printing Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: ART 135 Creating Visual Order, and ARTR 375 Screen Printing (repeated three times).

0d668764-1abb-428d-91b9-407f5c8ba784.description: The earner of this micro-credential can: identify the topic and related information in short informational and fictional texts, identify the main idea in short conversations, create simple sentences and ask appropriate follow-up questions during interactions, discuss familiar topics by creating simple sentences and asking appropriate follow-up questions, present personal information using simple sentences, and express preferences and explain feelings about familiar topics using simple sentences.
0d668764-1abb-428d-91b9-407f5c8ba784.name: Start Speaking German Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: GER 101 Elementary German I,  GER 102 Elementary German II, GER 201 Intermediate German I, and GER 202 Intermediate German II.

48cf0222-a46c-4b8f-a76e-acd8e49d4c18.description: The earner of this micro-credential can: identify the topic and related information in short informational and fictional texts, identify the main idea in short conversations, create simple sentences and ask appropriate follow-up questions during interactions, discuss familiar topics by creating simple sentences and asking appropriate follow-up questions, present personal information using simple sentences, and express preferences and explain feelings about familiar topics using simple sentences.
48cf0222-a46c-4b8f-a76e-acd8e49d4c18.name: Start Speaking Japanese Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: JPN 101 Elementary Japanese I,  JPN 102 Elementary Japanese II, JPN 201 Intermediate Japanese I, and JPN 202 Intermediate Japanese II.

9d95162d-14fe-47f0-bfbf-a626dee04fae.description: The earner of this micro-credential can: identify the topic and related information in short informational and fictional texts, identify the main idea in short conversations, create simple sentences and ask appropriate follow-up questions during interactions, discuss familiar topics by creating simple sentences and asking appropriate follow-up questions, present personal information using simple sentences, and express preferences and explain feelings about familiar topics using simple sentences.
9d95162d-14fe-47f0-bfbf-a626dee04fae.name: Start Speaking Spanish Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: SPI 101 Elementary Spanish I,  SPI 102 Elementary Spanish II, SPI 201 Intermediate Spanish I, and SPI 202 Intermediate Spanish II.

7763ec49-dcb9-49a5-9b45-fdbdab6be58c.description: The earner of this micro-credential can differentiate between an idea and a viable opportunity, develop a concept for a new business, understand the connection between a firm’s intelligence processes and overall strategy, and collect and process data into intelligence to advance innovation. They can compose a business strategy and an executive level pitch deck to communicate the strategy.
7763ec49-dcb9-49a5-9b45-fdbdab6be58c.name: Strategic Innovation through Competitive Intelligence Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: MKT 605 Marketing in Organizations, MBA 620 Ideation to Innovation, MBA 621 Competitive Intelligence, and MBA 622 Ideation to Value.

6ae519e7-943e-48df-8aea-d899246e6403.description: The earner of this micro-credential can identify species from live and preserved specimens. The earner can apply field techniques in flagging, mapping, and establishing wetlands boundaries; and survey techniques using a Trimble® differential GPS; and is able to identify hydrology and hydric soil indicators. The earner will have additional skills depending on the elective option selected.
6ae519e7-943e-48df-8aea-d899246e6403.name: Wetlands Management Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: Wetland Plant Identification, Wetland Delineation, and one elective.

51cc6b7c-d246-407a-a70c-81f2e441e6bf.description: The earner of this micro-credential demonstrates needed skills to facilitate interventions, and understands diversity issues as they pertain to providing culturally sensitive service. The earner can implement the steps outlined in a Wellness Recovery Action Plan, conduct effective motivational interviews, and has passed the Kentucky exam for becoming a Peer Support Specialist.
51cc6b7c-d246-407a-a70c-81f2e441e6bf.name: Adult Peer Support Specialist Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: HSR 102 Foundations for Recovery Support, HSR 103 Motivational Interviewing Skills, and HSR 104 Practicum in Recovery Support.

4ae057c5-0f92-46cd-9f25-57119ecca825.description: Earners of the Advanced Facebook Digital Marketing Certificate have gained foundational skills necessary for marketing roles across a range of companies. Skills include content marketing, branding, analytics, social media, search and display advertising, and email marketing. They are able to develop digital marketing plans, create content strategy briefs, and analyze a target audience using Google Analytics, develop campaigns using Facebook Ads, Search and Display Ads, and email marketing.
4ae057c5-0f92-46cd-9f25-57119ecca825.name: Advanced Facebook Digital Marketing Certificate from Northern Kentucky University

b5edd865-39be-4fcf-a8b8-5ae00393ee14.description: Earners of the Advanced Salesforce Administrator Career Certificate are equipped for CRM administrator roles and prepared to take the Salesforce administrator credential exam. They have essential skills including the ability to import data into Salesforce, use the Sales Cloud and Service Cloud products, maintain and customize a Salesforce instance, and configure advanced analytical capabilities. They can create reports and dashboards summarizing sales and track data in a typical sales process.
b5edd865-39be-4fcf-a8b8-5ae00393ee14.name: Advanced Salesforce Administrator Career Certificate from Northern Kentucky University

a0bac96a-27c2-4ca0-8217-11e2c0446ec1.description: Earners of the Advanced Tableau Data Analytics Certificate have gained foundational skills as well as statistical analysis and Python programming skills necessary for business and data analyst roles across a range of companies. They are able to run SQL queries, perform exploratory data analysis, construct a predictive model, perform an end-to-end analysis on real-world data using Python packages including NumPy, pandas, and matplotlib, and organize Python code within a Jupyter notebook.
a0bac96a-27c2-4ca0-8217-11e2c0446ec1.name: Advanced Tableau Data Analytics Certificate from Northern Kentucky University

Complete a curriculum of project-based assessments that demonstrate proficiency in statistical analysis and Python.

51830b72-dbbe-4181-af7a-4a755782cc24.description: The earner of this micro-credential is able to describe the normal aging processes and developmental tasks of older adults, understand a broad range of theories around contemporary issues in aging related to practice, and compare the dynamics of diverse older adults and their caregivers. The earner is able to identify the major theories related to later life development, explain ethics and values specific to the older adult population, and recognize the changing treatment needs of older adults.
51830b72-dbbe-4181-af7a-4a755782cc24.name: Aging & Society Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: ANT 375 Anthropology of Aging or SOC 342 Sociology of Aging;  HSR 314 Death, Dying, and Grief or PHI/REL 371 Death and the Afterlife; and NEU 101 Neuroscience for Life: From Sex to Society or SOC 480 Global Aging Issues and Policies.

59069013-66c9-4f17-a9fe-cf3a7b5173f0.description: The earner of this micro-credential can use archives as a resource and storage medium for paper and other two-dimensional objects, and understands archive operations. Able to effectively communicate both orally and in written form, the earner can prepare archive work plans and work with the public on archiving projects.
59069013-66c9-4f17-a9fe-cf3a7b5173f0.name: Archive Specialist Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title:
Complete these courses: HIS 625 Archives and Digital Humanities; HIS 689 Research and Writing Public History; and HIS 596 or HIS 696 Archive Internship, or
HIS 592 or HIS 692 Independent Research.

56a06f33-088e-406b-ab84-368532ebd509.description: The earner of this micro-credential can assess the needs of museum and archive collections, develop a plan addressing identified needs, and assess electronic and other record keeping systems to meet the needs of the institution and the public. The earner is able to accurately identify dates, periods, influences, materials, and makers.
56a06f33-088e-406b-ab84-368532ebd509.name: Artifact Care Specialist Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: HIS 609 Collections and Museum Management; HIS 630 American Decorative Arts or HIS 625 Archives and Digital Humanities; and HIS 596 or HIS 696 Archive Internship, or HIS 592 or HIS 692 Independent Study.

These skills include developing project plans, budgets and timelines; managing stakeholders; planning kickoff activities; mitigating risk and assuring quality. They are able to develop an agile release plan and manage a technical project from start to finish using Asana and Scrum.
3ddd4ad4-bd0d-4575-93c0-0c627d5de9fe.name: Asana Project Management Certificate + Agile from Northern Kentucky University

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: CIT 538 Cloud Computing and CIT 668 System Architecture.

8ccb4aab-c2ce-4917-99f8-00deccf57fa9.description: The earner of this micro-credential can describe the key concepts and theories of community and economic development, and apply analytical methods for community and economic development planning. They are able to examine how the Asset-Based Community Development approach can be applied, and how national and state policies influence community and economic development.
8ccb4aab-c2ce-4917-99f8-00deccf57fa9.name: Community and Economic Development Graduate Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: PAD 560 Community Development and PAD 561 Local Economic Development.

12599936-87a9-4bf4-901a-9e6d00b401cc.description: The earner of this micro-credential can describe the key concepts and theories of community and economic development, and apply analytical methods for community and economic development planning. They are able to examine how the Asset-Based Community Development approach can be applied, and how national and state policies influence community and economic development.
12599936-87a9-4bf4-901a-9e6d00b401cc.name: Community and Economic Development Undergraduate Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: PAD 560 Community Development and PAD 561 Local Economic Development.

71bb419a-651d-4de7-a4e3-0765dcd21528.description: The earner of this certificate can communicate business-relevant implications of data analyses, craft questions to ensure analysis projects succeed, and design logical and structured analysis plans. The earner can use Excel functions to organize, query, chart, and summarize data; analyze concepts and techniques for storytelling with data; assemble a dashboard; obtain usable data from the web, APIs, and databases; apply data cleaning techniques; and organize, merge, and manage data.
71bb419a-651d-4de7-a4e3-0765dcd21528.name: Data for Business Decision Making (with Getting & Cleaning Data) Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of all assessments in four courses offered via Coursera, with an overall average of at least 73% in each course: Data Visualization and Communication with Tableau, Duke University; Introduction to Data Analysis Using Excel, Rice University; Creating Dashboards and Storytelling with Tableau, University of California, Davis; and Getting and Cleaning Data, Johns Hopkins University.

ccf96169-ae28-4a4e-8441-b9393acd5093.description: The earner of this micro-credential can design and implement museum exhibits that are informative, attractive, and meet certain goals and objectives. Able to effectively communicate using the exhibit medium, the earner can develop complex historical narratives and place them in exhibit form.
ccf96169-ae28-4a4e-8441-b9393acd5093.name: Designing Experiences in Museums Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title:
Complete these courses: HIS 607 Exhibits in Museums and Historic Sites; HIS 605 Museum Education and Interpretation; and HIS 596 or HIS 696 Exhibit Internship, or
HIS 592 or HIS 692 Independent Research.

2d3c2709-440a-47a6-86c1-e0cb70a36237.description: The earner of this micro-credential exhibits knowledge of basic economic and personal finance concepts appropriate to K-12 educators and community stakeholders, and can implement innovative instructional materials and methodologies for economic reasoning and personal finance in diverse classroom settings. The earner understands learning and cognitive strategies for community stakeholders working with economics and financial literacy.
2d3c2709-440a-47a6-86c1-e0cb70a36237.name: Economics and Financial Literacy Education Undergraduate Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: ECO 580 Economics for Teachers and ECO 594 Teaching Econ/Fin Literacy Topics.

49e2c491-d10a-4976-a0fd-ccd2e19f9066.description: The earner of this micro-credential understands ethical and validity issues in ethnographic research, and has practiced skills in research design and ethnographic methods of data collection. The earner can analyze ethnographic data, resulting in an ethnographic monograph.
49e2c491-d10a-4976-a0fd-ccd2e19f9066.name: Ethnographic Research Methods Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: ANT 340 Ethnographic Methods and Research or SOC 322 Qualitative Research Methods;  ANT 342 Quantitative Methods in Anthropology or SOC 320 Social Research; and ANT 325 Applied Anthropology, or ANT 365 Ethnographic Field Methods or ANT 312 Social Organization.

b1718235-e826-400e-b541-8a619c989ea9.description: Earners of Facebook Digital Marketing Certificate have gained foundational skills necessary for marketing roles across a range of companies. dd3eeba6-1535-4fc9-9d3f-8f3142d9cf4c.description: The earner of this micro-credential understands the psychological and social factors that impact the experience of children and their families involved with health care, and exhibits skills for providing psychosocial aid to families with children dealing with medical conditions.

760b47cc-3b07-4e0e-96db-246c42edcbfa.description: The earner of this micro-credential can use GIS software to solve spatial problems and create quality maps by following fundamental cartographic map design principles.
760b47cc-3b07-4e0e-96db-246c42edcbfa.name: GIS and Mapping Graduate Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: PAD 550 Geographic Information Systems and PAD 515 Cartography.

16dd10da-4607-45c5-8215-060b9ab87ea8.description: The earner of this micro-credential understands the foundations of psychology and behavior modification, and how behavior affects health and fitness. They can apply behavior theories to improve health and fitness.
16dd10da-4607-45c5-8215-060b9ab87ea8.name: Health and Performance: Behavioral Approach Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: PSY 100 Introduction to Psychology, PSY 330 Behavior Modification, HEA 230 Personal Health and Wellness, and KIN 350 Psychology of Physical Activity.

cca70872-7c80-4920-9d75-113da07ee7ee.description: The earner of this micro-credential understands the history of the LGBTQIA+ community, including both obstacles and achievements. They have demonstrated cultural competency in terms of the LGBTQIA+ community, and know what intersectionality means and how it affects people’s perspectives; enhances communication; congeniality, and performance; and improves stakeholdership.
cca70872-7c80-4920-9d75-113da07ee7ee.name: LGBTQIA+ Studies Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: WGS 409 Queer Spirituality, WGS 405 Understanding Our LGBTQ Past, WGS 407 LBGTQ Cultural Competency Training, WGS 408 LGBTQ Top Ten

b2f846c8-fec1-4672-a053-61522406b587.description: The earner of this micro-credential can explain strategic marketing decisions, interpret marketing strategies and resulting consumer experiences, and use knowledge of buyer behavior to enhance strategic research and business decisions for clients. They can generate strategic decisions based on descriptive data, and communicate marketing actions derived from data analysis.
b2f846c8-fec1-4672-a053-61522406b587.name: Marketing Strategy and Analytics Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: MKT 605 Marketing in Organizations, MKT 620 Marketing Strategy, MKT 621 Consumer Behavior and Insights, and MKT 622 Marketing Analytics.

ad054a9b-c4f7-4a3b-9986-695dc2d7aec1.description: The earner of this micro-credential understands mobile app development language, environment and software development kits for multiple platforms. ad054a9b-c4f7-4a3b-9986-695dc2d7aec1.name: Mobile App Development Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: CSC 515 Android Mobile App Development and CSC 516 iOS Mobile App Development.

ace550c1-3455-4551-baae-9fa1b6fe28ae.description: The earner of this micro-credential can communicate orally and in written form, and interpret objects and subjects. HIS 592 or HIS 692 Independent Research.

ed83a410-c3d8-4938-a938-78952ced097e.description: The earner of this micro-credential has developed speaking, writing, reading, listening and cultural skills in French at an advanced level. 3a02a40c-01e4-4b6c-a1fe-60fea3ce1c32.description: The earner of this micro-credential understands the functioning of a database management system and its relationship to the computing environment in which it runs, as well as how to manage Oracle processes, storage structures, objects, and database users. 3a02a40c-01e4-4b6c-a1fe-60fea3ce1c32.name: Oracle Database Administration Micro-Credential

3a29f0a4-45fb-4ff1-b60e-e07a02dd435a.description: The earner of this micro-credential can describe contemporary issues and trends in rural education and public policy; critically evaluate current literature in the fields of rural education, health, and/or government; produce a research paper for advanced investigation and/or publication in a professional journal; and create an “Action Plan” that addresses an area of need. badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: EDU 534-001 Rural Leadership and Progress and EDU 535-001 Rural Leadership and Progress II - Field.

ec026677-99d6-4a1e-8b4f-759f11ec1945.description: The earner of this micro-credential can explain the reasons for the growth of sports as a key part of American and global society and culture, and the relationship between sports and various social institutions, as well as interpret issues dealing with diversity in sport. The earner can explain the steps for conducting research in sport studies, implement theories on the use of sports and the media as a means for future social change, and analyze the implications of such power and influence.
ec026677-99d6-4a1e-8b4f-759f11ec1945.name: Sports Values and Cultural Impact Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: KIN 385 Sociological and Psychological Dimensions of Physical Activity, SPB 200 Rivalry and Ritual in International Sports, and POP 205 Introduction to Popular Culture.

0cf7c6e9-3fda-4eba-ba98-e06ae49c36dd.description: The earner of this micro-credential can: identify the topic and related information in short informational and fictional texts, identify the main idea in short conversations, create simple sentences and ask appropriate follow-up questions during interactions, discuss familiar topics by creating simple sentences and asking appropriate follow-up questions, present personal information using simple sentences, and express preferences and explain feelings about familiar topics using simple sentences.
0cf7c6e9-3fda-4eba-ba98-e06ae49c36dd.name: Start Speaking French Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: FRE 101 Elementary French I,  FRE 102 Elementary French II, FRE 201 Intermediate French I, and FRE 202 Intermediate French II.

c966c7a2-9abf-4268-ab11-b556a2157b77.description: Using a research-based, student-centered approach, the earner of this micro-credential has demonstrated advanced understanding of elementary mathematics and effective teaching practices as defined by the National Council of Teachers of Mathematics.
c966c7a2-9abf-4268-ab11-b556a2157b77.name: Teaching Elementary Mathematics Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Two of these courses: MTE 650 Advanced Methods for Teaching Number P–2 , MTE 651 Advanced Methods for Teaching Number 3–5. MTE 652 Intervention Strategies for Elementary Mathematics Educators, MTE 653 Geometry and Measurement Methods and Content for P-5 Teachers, MTE 654 Advanced Number, Algebra and Data P–5. And one of these: MTE 650 Advanced Methods for Teaching Number P–2, MTE 651 Advanced Methods for Teaching Number 3–5, MTE 652 Intervention Strategies for Elementary Mathematics Educators.

250504ea-c3cd-44a0-96cd-3f2f9ba9d3f0.description: The earner of this micro-credential can recognize the characteristics and needs of gifted and talented youth from diverse backgrounds, and develop strategies to support the social and emotional development of gifted youth. The earner can design curriculum and apply instructional strategies that enhance gifted students' learning, and advocate for gifted learners to a variety of stakeholders.
250504ea-c3cd-44a0-96cd-3f2f9ba9d3f0.name: Understanding Gifted and Talented Youth Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: EDG 621 Introduction to Gifted Education, EDG 623 Teaching Creative and Higher Level Thinking, EDG 625 School Programs for Gifted Children, EDG 627 Seminar and Field Experience in Gifted Education.

e7cd6f0d-711e-4b7e-b3f5-49a1251493c2.description: The earner of this micro-credential understands advanced technologies for developing dynamic, or database-driven, websites, and can design and develop scalable, robust and extensible web applications and databases.
e7cd6f0d-711e-4b7e-b3f5-49a1251493c2.name: Web Development Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: CSC 550 Database Management System and CSC 556 Advanced Web Application Development.

f3fbe49e-1039-42b7-a357-0b1615409d0b.description: The earner of this micro-credential understands and can apply interpersonal and organizational communication theory in workplace contexts. The earner can effectively communicate in both written and oral forms at a variety of levels, from informal interpersonal interactions to formal, professional, large-group interactions.
f3fbe49e-1039-42b7-a357-0b1615409d0b.name: Workplace Communication Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete these courses: COM 620 Interpersonal Communication, COM 604 Organizational Communication, COM 603 Business Communication.
